trustfund:
TF025979-PHRD-SOCIAL PROTECTION PROJECT,TF035985-JAMAICA - SOCIAL INVESTMENT
            FUND PROJECT,TF035984-JAMAICA - SOCIAL INVESTMENT
            FUND PROJECT,TF033004-PAKISTAN - HEALTH & NUTRITION,TF024816-JAMAICA SOCIAL INVESTMENT FUND (JSIF),TF022516-NUTRITION PROJECT,TF029209-PHRD-SOCIAL INVESTMENT FUND PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome is rated
            satisfactory. However, project sustainability is unlikely:
            the prospects for the Jamaica Social Investment Fund (JSIF)
            remain uncertain as it only enjoys a temporary mandate, and
            decisions have not yet been made by the Government on its
            future. Both World Bank and Borrower performances are
            assessed as satisfactory. Lessons learned included the
            following: Contributing to the project's success were
            strong leadership coupled with the effective implementation
            of proven SIF policies and practices, a demand-driven
            participatory approach, careful project design and
            continuing surveillance from project authorities and those
            charged with directing government resources to mitigate
            poverty. Other considerations include assessing the level of
            social capital and social cohesion when estimating the
            processing time of subprojects; building in mechanisms for
            dealing with continuity issues; making mandatory the
            implementation of recommendations of the managmeent audit;
            the need to conduct an ex-ante capacity assessment of
            prospective partners and government agencies; the need for
            the Bank to help the implementing agency in order to ensure
            quality and timeliness of service delivery even though a
            professional firm has been contracted to improve the
            management information system; the need to give adequate
            attention to fiduciary matters; and the requirement to give
            special attention to rural road and small-scale water
            projects when a Social fund is inexperienced.
